DataElement.preferredName: Anal Neoplasm Disease Lesion Pigment Present Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether an anal or perianal lesion is pigmented.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Anal Neoplasm Disease Lesion Pigment Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to an anal neoplasm (a benign or malignant neoplasm involving the anus) and lesion (an area of abnormal tissue change) pigment (a substance that gives color to tissue) present (being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant neoplasm involving the anus.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the anal canal or anal margin.  Representative examples of benign neoplasms include squamous papilloma and papillary hidradenoma.  Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma, lymphoma, and melanoma.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.:A substance that gives color to tissue. Pigments are responsible for the color of skin, eyes, and hair.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
A substance that gives color to tissue. Pigments are responsible for the color of skin, eyes, and hair.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
